episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the unique softness of frog tongues, a World War II invention of garlic-infused chocolate bars for pilots, the survival instincts of Komodo dragons, and the potential benefits of dreaming about darts to improve one's game.

facts.fact: A frog's tongue is 10 times softer than a human's tongue.
During the Second World War, Britain invented chocolate bars infused with garlic to give to pilots who were shot down and needed to make their breath authentically French.
The producer of King Kong had read the story of W. Douglas Burden, who was the first person to properly film Komodo Dragons and bring back live specimens.
You can improve your darts game by training yourself to dream about darts.
